item.title: Scraping metrics exposed by Google Cloud Run services that require authentication
item.description: I’ve written a solution (gcp-oidc-token-proxy) that can be used in conjunction with Prometheus [OAuth] to authenticate requests so that Prometheus can scrape metrics exposed by e.g. Cloud Run services that require authentication. The solution resulted from my question on Stack overflow. Problem #1: Endpoint requires authentication Given a Cloud Run service URL for which: ENDPOINT="my-server-blahblah-wl.a.run.app" # Returns 200 when authentication w/ an ID token TOKEN="$(gcloud auth print-identity-token)" curl \ --silent \ --request GET \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --write-out "%{response_code}" \ --output /dev/null \ https://${ENDPOINT}/metrics # Returns 403 otherwise curl \ --silent \ --request GET \ --write-out "%{response_code}" \ --output /dev/null \ https://${ENDPOINT}/metrics Problem #2: Prometheus OAuth2 configuration is constrained
